discoverBlogEntriesData.title: The Ultimate Guide to Traveling in the Rainy Season

main.description:
The Philippines, with its stunning landscapes and rich cultural heritage, remains a captivating destination year-round. However, traveling during the rainy season, typically from June to November, presents unique challenges and opportunities. Here’s everything you need to know to make the most of your trip.

 

Packing essentials for wet weather

 

When traveling in the rainy season, packing the right essentials can make all the difference in your comfort and enjoyment. Here are some must-haves for your trip:

 

Waterproof Gear: Invest in high-quality waterproof gear, including a durable jacket, rain shoes, and a sturdy umbrella. These items will keep you dry and comfortable as you explore. A waterproof bag is also essential to protect your belongings.

Insect Repellent: Rainy weather can bring out mosquitoes and other insects. Consider bringing repellent or natural alternatives like citronella oil to protect yourself from bites.

Portable Charger: Packing a portable charger is essential for any trip, especially during the rainy season when power outages and limited charging opportunities are more likely. Some models include built-in flashlights and additional features which can save space in your luggage.

 

Choosing the right destination

Selecting the perfect destination for your rainy season travel is crucial. Some places are more enjoyable during wet weather than others. Here are a few tips for choosing the right destination:

 

Research Rainfall Patterns: Look for destinations with moderate rainfall and fewer chances of severe storms. Some tropical destinations have short, intense showers that quickly clear up, making them ideal for a rainy season visit.

City Escapes: Urban destinations often have plenty of indoor activities, museums, and cultural sites to explore, making them great choices for rainy days. Districts like Makati and Ortigas offer a plethora of indoor attractions that can keep you entertained regardless of the weather.

Scenic Beauty: Consider the unique charm of Siargao, where the rain enhances the island's lush scenery and creates ideal surfing conditions. On the other hand, Baguio’s cool climate becomes even more refreshing during the rainy season.

 

Indoor activities to keep you entertained

Rainy days don’t have to be boring. Many destinations offer a variety of indoor activities to keep you entertained throughout your stay:

 

Museums and Art Galleries: Spend a day exploring local museums and art galleries to soak in the culture and history of your destination. In Makati, the Ayala and Yuchengco Museums offer rich and immersive experiences for all visitors.

Shopping: Visit local markets and boutiques to discover unique souvenirs and enjoy some retail therapy. Indoor malls like Glorietta and The Podium offer vibrant shopping experiences sheltered from the rain.

Spa Treatments: Treat yourself to a relaxing spa day. Many resorts and hotels offer luxurious spa services that can help you unwind and recharge. Enjoy massages, facials, and other treatments designed to rejuvenate your body and mind.

 

Savoring comfort food and cozy meals

Rainy weather is perfect for indulging in comfort food and cozy meals. Here are some ideas to warm your heart and satisfy your taste buds:

 

Local Cuisine: Explore the local cuisine and try hearty soups, stews, and other comfort foods that are popular in the region. Enjoy a steaming bowl of bulalo or arroz caldo, which are sure to warm you up.

Cafes and Bakeries: The soft pattern of raindrops against the window creates a serene atmosphere, perfect for indulging in the comforting flavors of freshly baked treats. Whether you're sharing pastries with friends or enjoying a quiet moment to yourself, a cozy lounge offers a warm respite from the rain.

Hot Beverages: Warm up with hot beverages like coffee or tea. Seek out unique local variations such as hot tsokolate, a traditional Filipino hot chocolate made from pure cacao tablets and melted into a rich, thick drink.

 

Making the most of rainy days

Even when the weather doesn’t cooperate, there are plenty of ways to make the most of your rainy days:

 

Relax and Unwind: Imagine staying at a hotel and sinking into a bed adorned with plush sheets. The room is perfectly chilled, set to just the right temperature to ensure a restful sleep. Everything is within reach, and for those moments when you crave something extra, a simple call to room service is all it takes to bring you what you need.

Indoor Workouts: Stay active even when it’s raining by engaging in indoor workouts. Many hotels have fitness centers, or you can try yoga, Pilates, or other exercises in your room. Keeping up with your fitness routine will help you feel energized and healthy during your travels.

Plan Future Travels: Spend some time researching and planning your next adventure. Look up destinations, create itineraries, and dream about future trips. Use the downtime to gather inspiration and excitement for your next journey.

 

Traveling in the Philippines during the rainy season offers a unique and captivating experience. While the weather may be unpredictable, with a bit of preparation and flexibility, you can still enjoy the stunning landscapes, rich culture, and warm hospitality that the country is known for. 

 

Remember to pack all the right essentials, plan your itinerary with weather conditions in mind, and always prioritize safety. Whether you’re navigating the city streets or exploring the crystal-clear waters of its beautiful islands, the Philippines has endless adventures waiting for you.

discoverBlogEntriesData.title: Where to Next: Summer Destinations in the Philippines

main.description:
As the sun shines brighter and the temperature rises, it’s easy to tell that summer is already in the air. The Philippines, best known for its pristine beaches and breathtaking natural landscapes, is undeniably a top summer destination for locals and tourists alike. 

 

From award-winning popular destinations such as Palawan and Boracay to hidden idyllic spots on the rise such as Samal, Davao, and Sipalay, Negros Occidental, this tropical paradise offers an array of stunning destinations waiting to be explored. 

 

Join us as we unravel some of the most enticing summer destinations you won’t resist adding to your travel bucket list!

 

Boracay

Boracay, a beacon of a beach haven that captivated the hearts of travelers across the globe, is undeniably one of the most popular destinations in the Philippines. Renowned for its powdery white sand and clear turquoise waters, the island serves as a playground for relaxed beach lovers and adventure seekers alike. 

Thrill seekers can get their adrenaline fix in a number of water sports, including the likes of parasailing, stand-up paddle boarding, and flyboarding, while those looking for more relaxing activities can shop and dine at the D’Mall or sunbathe along the shores. Make sure to stop by Puka Shell Beach too, where you will experience the purity of the island!

Coron

Often referred to as the last frontier of the Philippines, the untouched beauty of Coron, Palawan, offers a captivating blend of natural wonders and cultural heritage. Popular for its towering limestone cliffs, crystal-clear lagoons, and stunning islands waiting to be explored, this slice of paradise is a stunner to both locals and avid travelers alike. 

Experience the magnificent cleanliness of Kayangan Lake, where you can admire panoramic views before going for a swim or dive, or kayak your way through the Twin Lagoon. Explore shipwrecks in the depths of the island and uncover the secrets of the underwater world brimming with vibrant marine life.

Sipalay, Negros Occidental

Thinking of going somewhere off-the-grid? Sipalay, Negros Occidental, may just be the breath of fresh air you’re looking for. Known as the “Jewel of the Sugar Island,"  Sipalay is an emerging beach destination boasting its rich Negrenese heritage, pristine beauty, and laid-back charm. 

What better way to spend your colorful summer days than by exploring the beauty and charm of an uncharted destination? Swim through the famed Tinagong Dagat or Sugar Beach, or dive under the depths of Campomanes Bay.

 

The Island Garden City of Samal, Davao

Tucked away in the Davao Gulf, the Island Garden City of Samal (or simply Samal Island) may just be your newest summer sanctuary. Vacationers and recreational seekers will be thrilled to explore its untouched beauty and tranquil shores. You can explore and experience its charm through a variety of excursions, including beach hopping, scuba diving, and snorkeling, to name a few.

 

It offers unique tourist attractions such as the Monfort Bat Cave, a Guinness World Record holder, housing the largest colony of Rousette fruit bats. The island is also home to the Giant Clam Sanctuary.

 

Your next summer destination with Discovery hotels and resorts

Best known for turning prime locations into your favorite destinations, Discovery hotels and resorts are thrilled to be your home for the summer! Whether it’s spending bright sunny days at the shores or a relaxing getaway in the heart of a bustling city location, you can immerse yourself in the unique essence of each destination while providing a sanctuary that’s meticulously designed to be a home away from home.

discoverBlogEntriesData.title: A Closer Look on Sustainable Tourism

main.description:
In a changing world where the global community grapples with the urgent need for environmental preservation, sustainable tourism takes center stage now more than ever. Often referred to as the conscientious approach to a traveling lifestyle, the initiative seeks to reduce the overall negative impacts of tourism on the environment and local communities. 

Let us take a closer look at how sustainable tourism is beyond just a trend; rather, it can be a transformative approach that will redefine the world of travel and exploration.

What is sustainable tourism?

According to the definition of the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO), sustainable tourism is “tourism that takes full account of its current and future economic, social, and environmental impacts, addressing the needs of visitors, the industry, the environment, and host communities.”

It is a forward-thinking approach that seeks to balance the enjoyment and exploration of destinations with the desire to protect and preserve them for future generations. Having a deep understanding of sustainable tourism is essential to safeguarding our planet and its diverse communities.

Let’s take a closer look at its importance and how it benefits both travelers and destinations alike.

The importance of sustainable tourism

A demonstration of local and sustainable craftsmanship at Sipalay, Negros Occidental

Environmental Protection

Natural landscapes, wildlife, and a well-balanced ecosystem contribute to what makes destinations unique and breathtaking. Without sustainable practices in place, it can endanger the natural beauty and biodiversity of the destination.

Cultural Preservation

Fostering cultural preservation allows travelers to experience and appreciate the heritage and traditions of the destinations they visit. Sustainable practices minimize the negative impacts of tourism, ensuring the preservation of tourist spots and their vibrancy for future generations.

Enhanced Travel Experiences

More authentic and enriching travel experiences will await travelers. Through responsible engagement with the local community, tourists can gain deeper insights and create lasting memories while being aware of the positive contributions they have brought to the locale.

How to practice sustainable tourism

By adopting mindful and eco-friendly practices, your travel memories will not only be memorable but also impactful and extra meaningful. Together, let us explore the practical steps on how you can make a difference through the practice of sustainable tourism.

Minimize Waste and Consumption

Waste and consumption are at the forefront of pressing environmental issues. By making conscious choices in our everyday lives, we make a collective contribution to a healthier planet, securing a more sustainable future ahead. 

 

Here’s one example. 


A beach clean-up initiative at Discovery Coron (known as Club Paradise Palawan)

Discovery Coron, known as Club Paradise Palawan, is one of the Philippines’ well-loved tropical paradise destinations, popular for its stunningly remote location along the UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Although abundant in the finest of nature’s resources, one of the challenges that the resort has faced is the lack of regular waste collection.

Discovery Coron’s EcoConserve Program: Transforming waste into wonderful

To address this, the resort launched the EcoConserve Program, a collective effort to transform waste into something beautiful and functional. For instance, empty wine bottles are repurposed as vase decorations in the restaurant, and driftwood washed ashore is turned into unique chairs.

The EcoConserve project highlights the campaign to phase out Single-Use Plastics (SUPs)

The resort has also joined the campaign to phase out single plastic to address the growing concern over plastic waste. Instead of plastic mineral bottles, EcoPure water bottles are available in the rooms. Guests can enjoy sipping their beverages with sugarcane straws, instead of plastic ones. Laundry bags have also made the switch from plastic to recyclable fabric.

Turtle Hatchlings for release at Discovery Coron

The shores also serve as a Turtle Nesting Site for Hawkbill Sea Turtles and Sea Green Turtles every year, where approximately 200 hatchlings are released back into the ocean.


These are only some of the resort’s notable initiatives. To learn more, you can visit Discovery Coron’s website.

Choosing Eco-Friendly Accommodations

Discovery Coron: A sustainable tropical paradise in Palawan

Choosing destinations that prioritize sustainability makes room for a reduced carbon footprint and supports conservation efforts. What sets eco-friendly hotels apart from traditional accommodations is their commitment to environmental stewardship and sustainable practices.

Manami Resort: A forerunner in eco-friendly tourism in Sipalay, Negros Occidental

Boasting its natural resources and stunning landscapes, the Philippines is an ideal destination for eco-conscious travelers. Accommodations like Discovery Coron (known as Club Paradise Palawan) and Manami Resort showcase this commitment with their sustainable practices and initiatives. From farm-to-table practices to the preservation of the local culture, these steps, no matter how small, create a big impact on the environment and the community. 

 

By prioritizing sustainable tourism, you contribute to preserving our home planet and ensuring that future generations can enjoy the same breathtaking experiences.

In a changing world where the global community grapples with the urgent need for environmental preservation, sustainable tourism takes center stage now more than ever. Often referred to as the conscientious approach to a traveling lifestyle, the initiative seeks to reduce the overall negative impacts of tourism on the environment and local communities. 

Let us take a closer look at how sustainable tourism is beyond just a trend; rather, it can be a transformative approach that will redefine the world of travel and exploration.

What is sustainable tourism?

According to the definition of the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO), sustainable tourism is “tourism that takes full account of its current and future economic, social, and environmental impacts, addressing the needs of visitors, the industry, the environment, and host communities.”

It is a forward-thinking approach that seeks to balance the enjoyment and exploration of destinations with the desire to protect and preserve them for future generations. Having a deep understanding of sustainable tourism is essential to safeguarding our planet and its diverse communities.

Let’s take a closer look at its importance and how it benefits both travelers and destinations alike.

The importance of sustainable tourism

A demonstration of local and sustainable craftsmanship at Sipalay, Negros Occidental

Environmental Protection

Natural landscapes, wildlife, and a well-balanced ecosystem contribute to what makes destinations unique and breathtaking. Without sustainable practices in place, it can endanger the natural beauty and biodiversity of the destination.

Cultural Preservation

Fostering cultural preservation allows travelers to experience and appreciate the heritage and traditions of the destinations they visit. Sustainable practices minimize the negative impacts of tourism, ensuring the preservation of tourist spots and their vibrancy for future generations.

Enhanced Travel Experiences

More authentic and enriching travel experiences will await travelers. Through responsible engagement with the local community, tourists can gain deeper insights and create lasting memories while being aware of the positive contributions they have brought to the locale.

How to practice sustainable tourism

By adopting mindful and eco-friendly practices, your travel memories will not only be memorable but also impactful and extra meaningful. Together, let us explore the practical steps on how you can make a difference through the practice of sustainable tourism.

Minimize Waste and Consumption

Waste and consumption are at the forefront of pressing environmental issues. By making conscious choices in our everyday lives, we make a collective contribution to a healthier planet, securing a more sustainable future ahead. 

 

Here’s one example. 


A beach clean-up initiative at Discovery Coron (known as Club Paradise Palawan)

Discovery Coron, known as Club Paradise Palawan, is one of the Philippines’ well-loved tropical paradise destinations, popular for its stunningly remote location along the UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Although abundant in the finest of nature’s resources, one of the challenges that the resort has faced is the lack of regular waste collection.

Discovery Coron’s EcoConserve Program: Transforming waste into wonderful

To address this, the resort launched the EcoConserve Program, a collective effort to transform waste into something beautiful and functional. For instance, empty wine bottles are repurposed as vase decorations in the restaurant, and driftwood washed ashore is turned into unique chairs.

The EcoConserve project highlights the campaign to phase out Single-Use Plastics (SUPs)

The resort has also joined the campaign to phase out single plastic to address the growing concern over plastic waste. Instead of plastic mineral bottles, EcoPure water bottles are available in the rooms. Guests can enjoy sipping their beverages with sugarcane straws, instead of plastic ones. Laundry bags have also made the switch from plastic to recyclable fabric.

Turtle Hatchlings for release at Discovery Coron

The shores also serve as a Turtle Nesting Site for Hawkbill Sea Turtles and Sea Green Turtles every year, where approximately 200 hatchlings are released back into the ocean.


These are only some of the resort’s notable initiatives. To learn more, you can visit Discovery Coron’s website.

discoverBlogEntriesData.title: Your Guide to a Seamless Travel Experience

main.description:
Whether it’s a solo travel adventure, a romantic retreat, or a family getaway, nothing beats the bubbling excitement of an upcoming trip! While navigating unfamiliar destinations can sometimes leave you feeling overwhelmed, don’t worry! With the right mindset and preparation, you’re on your way to a seamless travel experience.

Join us as we explore essential tips to help you make the most of your trip.

 

Research your destination

Familiarity with your chosen destination is the first step to making the most of your trip. For instance, having a background in the local culture will also give you an idea of what attractions to visit, activities to try, and signature dishes to feast on.

Moreover, being aware of the destination’s customs and traditions will also help in raising awareness about the specific destination’s proper etiquette, including what to wear and how to behave in public. For example, on Boracay Island, wearing light clothing over swimwear when entering establishments is highly advised as a sign of respect for the island’s culture.

 

Create a flexible itinerary

While being spontaneous has its perks, having an outline of your travel plans, such as including your transportation, accommodation, and activities, can help transition you to a smooth sailing journey. It’s best to keep your travel itinerary flexible; it does not have to be something that you have to follow strictly. This will allow you to have more fun than worrying about following your schedule.

 

Maximize your time

A seamless travel experience includes maximizing your time. This will enable you to achieve a full travel experience as you immerse yourself in the destination’s culture, attractions, and activities. Despite the limited number of days during a vacation, the efficient use of your time can enhance the overall quality of your travel experience. This is the perfect chance to fulfill your travel aspirations as you tick off some items from your bucket list.

 

Explore your accommodation options with Discovery hotels and resorts

Choosing the right accommodation greatly matters while you are on vacation. It’s important to find comfort and ease as you relax after a long day of excursions and thrilling activities. Deeply rooted in providing a “Service That’s All Heart,” Discovery hotels and resorts are ready to welcome you to a home away from home. Whether you are seeking a breathtaking beach destination or a vibrant urban oasis, each property is meticulously designed for every discerning traveler.

Have a look at your guide below:

You can make the most of your seamless travel experience with a touch of  ‘Service That’s All Heart’ with Discovery hotels and resorts. For more information, visit our website at www.discoveryhotels-resorts.com
